{{ja-kanjitab|sort=ゆだや|yomi=irr|ゆ|たい|k2=だや}}

===Etymology===
From {{der|ja|sort=ゆだや|la|Iūdaea}}.<ref>{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref>{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> Alternatively, originally from {{der|ja|sort=ゆだや|nl|Judea}},<ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref> followed by a later shift in pronunciation likely influenced by the ultimate {{etyl|la|-}} [[etymon]] {{m|la|Iūdaea}}.

The spelling is an example of {{ateji|sort=ゆだや}}, from {{der|sort=ゆだや|ja|zh|猶太}}.
